summary.para: Lists values that specify the interaction mode for the keyboard and cursor.
This tool is used for navigation. The end-user can browse the document by moving the mouse while pressing the left button.

This tool is used to change the zoom level and navigate in a document. The end-user can increase the zoom level by simply clicking, decrease the zoom level by clicking while pressing the Ctrl key, or zoom in on a portion of a page by dragging the rectangle around it.
This tool is used for navigation in a document. You can also select text and images in a document to copy using a keyboard and mouse.
This tool is used to highlight a text.
This tool is used to strikethrough a text.
This tool is used to underline a text.

summary.para: Occurs after clicking a hyperlink addressing an external URI (universal resource identifier).
Identifies the routed event.
Lists values that specify the thumbnails viewer state.
The PDF thumbnails panel is collapsed.
The PDF thumbnails panel is expanded.
The PDF thumbnails panel is visible.
Lists values that specify the panel style of the outlines viewer.

The outlines panel is positioned above the document window. Moving the cursor away from the panel will cause it to collapse. Clicking on the panel button will expand the outlines panel without sliding.
This mode is similar to DockPanel.
The outlines panel is placed in the PDF Viewer without overlapping the document window.
Lists values that specify the panel style of the attachments viewer.

The attachments panel is positioned above the document window. Moving the cursor away from the panel will cause it to collapse. Clicking on the panel button will expand the attachments panel without sliding.
This mode is similar to DockPanel.
The attachments panel is placed in the PDF Viewer without overlapping the document window.
Provides access to the PDF thumbnails viewer settings.
Initializes a new instance of the PdfThumbnailsViewerSettings class with the default settings.

member.name: P:DevExpress.Xpf.PdfViewer.PdfThumbnailsViewerSettings.HideThumbnailsViewer

summary.para: Gets or sets a value which specifies whether the PDF thumbnails viewer is hidden.

member.value: true to hide the thumbnails viewer; false to show the thumbnails viewer. The default value is false.

summary.para: Identifies the dependency property.
Fires after any modifications in the thumbnails viewer are made by changing PDF Viewer settings.

member.name: P:DevExpress.Xpf.PdfViewer.PdfThumbnailsViewerSettings.ThumbnailsViewerInitialState

summary.para: Gets or sets the thumbnails viewer visible state after loading a PDF document.

member.value: One of the values. The default value is Null.

summary.para: Identifies the dependency property.

member.name: P:DevExpress.Xpf.PdfViewer.PdfThumbnailsViewerSettings.ThumbnailsViewerState

summary.para: Specifies the thumbnails viewer visible state.

member.value: One of the values. The default value is Collapsed.

summary.para: Identifies the dependency property.

member.name: P:DevExpress.Xpf.PdfViewer.PdfThumbnailsViewerSettings.ThumbnailsViewerStyle

summary.para: Gets or sets a style applied to the thumbnails viewer. This is a dependency property.

member.value: A Style object providing corresponding style settings.

summary.para: Identifies the dependency property.
Updates the properties of the PDF thumbnails viewer.
Lists values that specify the layout of the navigation panels.

Navigation panels are positioned above the document window. Moving the cursor away from the navigation panel will cause it to collapse. Clicking on the panel button will expand the navigation panel without sliding.
This mode is similar to DockPanel.
Navigation panels are placed in the PDF Viewer without overlapping the document window.
